element.name: Marlay Cache by Bootle, Traditional Cache (1/1)
element.description: Located in a beautiful park in south county Dublin
element.long-description:
This cache is located in Marlay Park in south county Dublin. The park is a great amenity with acres of space to stroll around and many facilities for all the family to enjoy. Amongst the facilities provided at Marlay are a nine-hole golf course, a BMX cycle track, a cricket pitch, tennis courts, 14 football pitches, a childrens' playground, a walled garden (with Peacocks!) and a model railway. In recent times, Marlay has become a popular music venue for concert goers, hosting such renowned international acts as David Gray, Sting, Van Morrison and R.E.M. Every Saturday the park hosts a Farmer's Market with many food and craft stalls. The park is also the start of the 120km Wicklow Way walking trail. Nearby is Saint Enda's Park, where Padraig Pearse's school is. For some park history, visit this site (http://www.dlrcoco.ie/parks/marlay.htm).
There are two car parks for the park, one at the south end of the park, off the R113 (College Road), and one at the east side, off Grange Road. On a fine day the Grange Road car park will fill up early, so it's advisable to park at the College Road car park. The cache is in a tupperware box.
The park opening hours are -
Nov-Jan: 10am-5pm
Feb-Mar: 10am-6pm
Apr: 10am-8pm
May-Aug: 10am-9pm
Sept: 10am-8pm
Oct: 10am-7pm
(Thanks to Donnacha for supplying these!)

ul.li:
2010-06-14T19:00:00Z : Found it by Wicca Cailín
Picked this one up after a hard days work to cheer myself up but no TB or GC??? [:(] The beautiful park still cheered me up a little. The place was full of people. TFTC.

2010-06-13T19:00:00Z : Write note by Mac Aroni Senior
GC drop

2010-05-25T19:00:00Z : Found it by oldnavycarl
Second time lucky with this one. Found with Annalivia. Cant believe I had been standing over it on my previous! Anyway first of four on this lovely evening! There were no travel bugs in this box so geocoin log history needs to be updated.

2010-05-24T19:00:00Z : Found it by garrathtormey
Interesting find, especially when you accidentally get lost and traipse through rough ground and undergrowth. Nothing too special about the cache except it was the first cache that both Sid and myself found together. Luckily it was a glorious day out

wpt.name: GCJGEV
wpt.desc: Marlay Cache by Bootle, Traditional Cache (1/1)
